envRaster 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Add cell to df with lat/long

Source: R/add_raster_cell.R
add_raster_cell.Rd

Add cell to df with lat/long

add_raster_cell(
  ras,
  df,
  x = "long",
  y = "lat",
  crs_df = 4326,
  add_xy = FALSE,
  return_old_xy = FALSE,
  add_val = FALSE,
  force_new = FALSE
)

Arguments

ras

SpatRaster, or path to raster (needs to be path if running in parallel), with cell numbers to extract

df

Dataframe with x/y columns

x, y

Character. Name of columns in df with x and y coordinates

crs_df

Single length vector. What crs are x and y?

add_xy

Logical. Generate (centroid) x and y coords from cell? If TRUE, these will be returned as ras_x and ras_y.

return_old_xy

Logical. If true, the original x and y values will be returned as old_x and old_y.

add_val

Logical. If true the value(s) for cell will be extracted.

force_new

Logical. If there is already a column cell in df, remove it first?

Value

df with additional column cell with cell numbers from x and, dependent on: add_xy columns x and y; and add_val any values from ras.

Examples


  #library(envRaster)

  out_dir <- file.path(system.file(package = "envRaster"), "examples")

  base_file <- fs::path(out_dir, "cube", "base.tif")

  if(!file.exists(base_file)) {

    make_base_grid(aoi
                   , out_res = 30
                   , out_epsg = 8059
                   , out_file = base_file
                   , datatype = "INT1U"
                   , overwrite = TRUE
                   )
  }

  base <- terra::rast(base_file)

  sample <- matrix(nrow = 2, ncol = 2) %>% # include some NA x and y values
    rbind(sf::st_sample(aoi, 100) %>%
            sf::st_transform(crs = 4326) %>%
            sf::st_coordinates()
          ) %>%
    tibble::as_tibble() %>%
    dplyr::mutate(attribute = sample(letters[1:10], nrow(.), replace = TRUE))
#> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.7.2, PROJ 9.3.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE

  # just cell
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 2
#>      cell attribute
#>     <dbl> <chr>    
#>  1     NA h        
#>  2     NA a        
#>  3  60123 a        
#>  4 116512 g        
#>  5 109467 j        
#>  6 102996 a        
#>  7 121265 e        
#>  8 129185 f        
#>  9  64612 a        
#> 10  81755 f        
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # cell and cell centroids
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 4
#>      cell attribute cell_X cell_Y
#>     <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1     NA h            NA    NA  
#>  2     NA a            NA    NA  
#>  3  60123 a           140.  -34.5
#>  4 116512 g           140.  -34.6
#>  5 109467 j           140.  -34.6
#>  6 102996 a           140.  -34.6
#>  7 121265 e           140.  -34.6
#>  8 129185 f           140.  -34.6
#>  9  64612 a           140.  -34.5
#> 10  81755 f           140.  -34.5
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # cell, cell centroids and original 'x' and 'y'
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , return_old_xy = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 6
#>      cell old_X old_Y attribute cell_X cell_Y
#>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1     NA   NA   NA   h            NA    NA  
#>  2     NA   NA   NA   a            NA    NA  
#>  3  60123  140. -34.5 a           140.  -34.5
#>  4 116512  140. -34.6 g           140.  -34.6
#>  5 109467  140. -34.6 j           140.  -34.6
#>  6 102996  140. -34.6 a           140.  -34.6
#>  7 121265  140. -34.6 e           140.  -34.6
#>  8 129185  140. -34.6 f           140.  -34.6
#>  9  64612  140. -34.5 a           140.  -34.5
#> 10  81755  140. -34.5 f           140.  -34.5
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # cell, cell centroids, cell values and original 'x' and 'y'
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , return_old_xy = TRUE
                  , add_val = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 7
#>      cell old_X old_Y attribute cell_X cell_Y  base
#>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl> <int>
#>  1     NA   NA   NA   h            NA    NA      NA
#>  2     NA   NA   NA   a            NA    NA      NA
#>  3  60123  140. -34.5 a           140.  -34.5     1
#>  4 116512  140. -34.6 g           140.  -34.6     1
#>  5 109467  140. -34.6 j           140.  -34.6     1
#>  6 102996  140. -34.6 a           140.  -34.6     1

#>  8 129185  140. -34.6 f           140.  -34.6     1
#>  9  64612  140. -34.5 a           140.  -34.5     1
